Marie Curie: Marie Curie was a pioneering scientist who made significant contributions to the field of physics and chemistry. Swapping places with her would allow me to experience the challenges and triumphs she faced as a woman in a male-dominated field. I would also love to learn more about her passion for science and her dedication to advancing knowledge.

Leonardo da Vinci: Leonardo da Vinci was a true Renaissance man, known for his contributions to art, science, and technology. Swapping places with him would allow me to witness firsthand the birth of the Renaissance and the impact it had on the world. I would also love to learn more about his curiosity and his ability to think outside the box.

Mahatma Gandhi: Mahatma Gandhi was a political and spiritual leader who played a key role in India's struggle for independence. Swapping places with him would allow me to experience firsthand the challenges and triumphs of the Indian independence movement. I would also love to learn more about his philosophy of nonviolence and his commitment to social justice.

Nelson Mandela: Nelson Mandela was a political leader and anti-apartheid activist who played a key role in ending apartheid in South Africa. Swapping places with him would allow me to experience firsthand the challenges and triumphs of the anti-apartheid movement. I would also love to learn more about his commitment to social justice and his ability to bring people together.

Steve Jobs: Steve Jobs was a co-founder of Apple and a pioneer in the technology industry. Swapping places with him would allow me to witness firsthand the development of the personal computer and the impact it had on the world. I would also love to learn more about his vision for the future of technology and his ability to think ahead of his time.
